BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CLAY CENTER FOR THE ARTS & SCIENCES

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL ENTERTAINING AND INSPIRATIONAL EXPERIENCES IN THE ARTS AND SCIENCE FOR ALL PEOPLE OF WEST VIRGINIA AND THE REGION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL, ENTERTAINING, AND INSPIRATIONAL EXPERIENCES IN THE ARTS AND SCIENCES FOR ALL PEOPLE OF WEST VIRGINIA AND THE REGION.
IRS990.Desc: THE CLAY CENTER OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE ARRAY OF ARTS, SCIENCE, AND INTERDISCIPLINARY PROGRAMMING, AS WELL AS EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. BOTH ON AND OFF-SITE PROGRAMS MAY INCLUDE PERFORMANCES, RESIDENCIES, WORKSHOPS, ART EXHIBITIONS, PLANETARIUM DEMONSTRATIONS, LARGE FORMAT FILM SCREENINGS, SPECIAL ART AND/OR SCIENCE DEMONSTRATIONS, SCHOOL AND PUBLIC TOURS OF PERMANENT INTERACTIVE SCIENCE GALLERIES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY OUTREACH OR SPECIAL EVENTS HELD THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ARE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF CUSTOMIZED EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ALIGNED WITH THE RELEVANT STATE AND NATIONAL ACADEMIC CONTENT STANDARDS FOR PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS AND EDUCATORS. IN ADDITION, ANOTHER SERVICE AREA INCLUDES THE CARE, MAINTENANCE AND ON-GOING ROTATIONAL PUBLIC PRESENTATION OF AN APPROXIMATELY 800 ITEM PERMANENT ART COLLECTION PRIMARILY FOCUSED ON 19TH AND 20TH CENTURY AMERICAN ART.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOCUS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S PERMANENT ART COLLECTION IS PRIMARILY 19TH, 20TH AND 21ST CENTURY WORK BY AMERICAN ARTISTS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON WORKS ON PAPER. ITEMS CONSIDERED FOR ACCESSION AND DE-ACCESSION ARE CAREFULLY WEIGHED WITH REGARD TO RELEVANCE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION, ITS SUITABILITY FOR THE COLLECTION AND THE ABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION TO CARE FOR THE OBJECT AND USE IT EFFECTIVELY. EACH ITEM CONSIDERED FOR ACCESSION AND DE-ACCESSION IS FIRST PRESENTED TO THE ACQUISITION COMMITTEE, AND THEN PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR FINAL APPROVAL.

THE FOCUS OF THE ORGANIZATIONS PERMANENT ART COLLECTION IS PRIMARILY 19TH, 20TH AND 21ST CENTURY WORK BY AMERICAN ARTISTS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON WORKS OF PAPER. THIS COLLECTION IS USED TO FURTHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS IN THE VISUAL ARTS.

THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS RESTRICTED BY DONORS ARE HELD IN PERPETUITY. THE EARNING ON THOSE FUNDS ARE USED TO PROVDE ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR FIVE CATEGORIES: OPERATIONS, BUILDING MAINTENANCE, OUTREACH PROGRAMS, EXHIBIT RENEWAL, AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS.
THE GRANT RECEIPTIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN INTERIM REPORT AS WELL AS A FINAL REPORT. THESE REPORTS INCLUDE FINANCIAL DATA AS WELL AS THE SUCCESSES OF THE PROGRAM.

THE COLLECTIONS, WHICH WERE RECEIVED THROUGH DONATION OR THROUGH THE COLLECTORS CLUB SINCE THE ORGANIZATION'S INCEPTION, ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION. COLLECTORS CLUB COLLECTS DUES FROM ITS MEMBERS IN ORDER TO PURCHASE WORKS OF ART PURSUANT TO THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES. INCOME IS RECLASSIFIED TO UNRESTRICTED INCOME AS A RELEASE FROM RESTRICTION AND THE PURCHASE COSTS ARE RECOGNIZED AS A PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSE. NO VALUE IS REPORTED FOR THE IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION OF ART.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VIRGINIA KING HAS A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP WITH THOMAS KITTREDGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM PREPARES THE FORM 990, WHICH IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT/CEO, CFO, AND TREASURER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST SURVEYS COMPLETED BY EACH BOARD MEMBER AND EVALUATES THE RELATIONSHIPS TO DETERMINE IF THERE ARE ANY CONFLICTS WITH THE CENTER'S BUSINESS DEALINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE GATHERS COMPARABLE DATA WHEN DETERMINING THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S COMPENSATION. THEY LOOK AT SALARY DATA COMPILED BY INDUSTRY GROUPS (AAM, APAP, AND ASTC) AS WELL AS LOOKING AT FORM 990'S OF SIMILAR NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS IS UNCHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT OVERSEES THE AUDIT.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: HOLDS THE TITLE TO LAND THE ARTS AND SCIENCE CENTER IS BUILT ON
